intro: Dockrillia racemosa, commonly known as the clustered dockrillia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems that bear clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The leaves are typically oval-shaped with a rough, hairy texture, and they are arranged alternately along the stem. This plant is often found in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
